study_plan_entry.title: Basic principles of drug action at the cardiovascular system

free_text.Learning outcomes: The aim of this course is two-fold:[br/]i) to describe the molecular properties of some important drug targets[br/]ii) to illustrate some applications of drugs active at the nervous and cardiovascular systems.
free_text.Content: Basic principles of drug action at the cardiovascular system[br/]1) Pharmacology of the cholinergic and adrenergic system[br/]2) Molecular pharmacology of G protein-coupled receptors[br/]3) Molecular pharmacology of ion channels[br/]4) Anti-hypertensive and vasodilator drugs[br/]5) Anti-disrythmic drugs[br/]6) Anti-coagulant and lipid lowering drugs
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Solid knowledge of cardiac physiology and pathology
